feed.subtitle: SAP HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: how to clear HANA memory without restarting the Database ?
entry.content:
HANA DB memory has been filled, is there any way to clear HANA memory without restarting the Database?

Are there any possible options?

entry.title: Production Plant for Customer JIT call in nJIT (Next-Generation JIT)
entry.content:
Hello,

We are using the nJIT S2C (Supply-to-Customer) scenario and receive the JitCallRequest via API calls.
Now, we would like to include the "Production Plant (external)" information in the API payload. We are not using SAP for the production plant. 

`AssemblyLocation` fields is using for customer's assembly location.

Could you please advise:

  • Which field in the JitCallRequest API is appropriate for this data?

  • If there is no standard field, what is the recommended way to include such external production plant information (e.g., through extension or custom field)?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: Adjust amounts in fixed asset depreciation areas
entry.content:
REQUEST: Adjust amounts in fixed asset depreciation areas
The client reports that they wish to massively adjust the acquisition and accumulated depreciation amounts in fixed asset depreciation areas 02 (USD currency) and 03 (EUR currency). The main depreciation area (area 01) is in VED currency, and the amounts are correct. Depreciation (AFAB) has already been executed for the current period: 12 (December), 2024.


Procedure 1:

Transaction ABZU allows you to adjust the accumulated depreciation as of December 31, 2024.

AW01N Areas 02 and 03

The AFAB is executed again in Re-execution mode. The AFAB run in TEST mode shows no problems:

However, when running in final mode, the RAPOST2000 program does not perform the accounting.

Procedure 2:

Because the RAPOST2000 program does not post in RERUN mode, a post-capitalization is attempted via transaction ABNAN. However, this transaction forces posting to area 01, which has the correct VED amounts. Direct post-capitalization is not permitted for depreciation areas 02 and 03.

The OABC is reviewed and it is found that the transfer values in areas 02 and 03 are derived from area 01.

The flag in the Ident. box is unchecked, but when trying to save, SAP displays message AC646.


PARV 04: It is not possible to transfer values from depreciation area 01.


Message number: AC646
Diagnosis
In the PARV chart of depreciation, the values for depreciation area 04 should be transferred from depreciation area 01. However, this is not possible because the value management for acquisition and production costs has been defined differently for areas 01 and 04.

The flag in the Ident. box is unchecked, but when trying to save, SAP displays message AC646.
PARV 04: It is not possible to transfer values from depreciation area 01.
Message number: AC646
Diagnosis
In the PARV chart of depreciation, the values for depreciation area 04 should be transferred from depreciation area 01. However, this is not possible because the value management for acquisition and production costs has been defined differently for areas 01 and 04.

entry.title: is the a transaction where I can get the value of mhdrz for products on a DESADV message without goi
entry.content: I need to find the life rule (MHDRZ) for a product when a delivery was created and messaged to the 3PL (the DESADV message). Is the a transaction that I can use without going through IDoc individual lines?

entry.title: Do we have to import lets encrypt root CA on HANA 2.0?
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

We are currently transitioning our TLS certificate root CA. Previously, we used DigiCert Global Root G2 to sign our TLS certificates. We are now in the process of switching our root CA to Let's Encrypt ISRG Root X1.

Our previous setup https://me.sap.com/notes/3400997  involves. We need to establish a secure connection using this new certificate chain.

I am wondering if we need to follow a similar process as described in the SAP Help Portal documentation for importing root CAs: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_HANA_PLATFORM/6b94445c94ae495c83a19646e7c3fd56/86e96624e9a74e77994f7544db51061c.html?q=certificate+CA 

SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud

entry.title: How to Get Remaining Balance for Specific Line Item of an Invoice or Advance
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôm trying to get a report in SAP that shows the remaining balance against a particular line item of an invoice or advance payment.

I have already tried the following:

  • J3RFPCR ‚Äì This only shows the original payment document for Special G/L indicator ‚ÄòA‚Äô (Down Payments) but not for other types of transactions.

  • S_ALR_87012105 ‚Äì This doesn‚Äôt provide the line-item level remaining balance information I‚Äôm looking for.

üëâ Internally, the system is working correctly ‚Äì when I run F-53 (Post Outgoing Payment), SAP perfectly shows how much balance is left against that line item and how much I have already adjusted. But I need a report or transaction to view this information directly without going into F-53.

What I need is:

‚úÖ A standard report or method to get the remaining open amount for each line item in an invoice/advance (not just at header level).
‚úÖ Ability to see it for all Special G/L indicators, not just for ‚ÄòA‚Äô.

Is there any:

  • Standard report or transaction code?

  • Table combination or query that can achieve this?

  • Or do I need to go for a custom report? - I have tried table level but didn't get it, BSE_CLR, BSEG

Any suggestions or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: How to know SAP license usage of my company?
entry.content:
Hi Experts 

In our company, we have procured 155 SAP licenses.  We have installed SAP ECC and S/4HANA (155 licenses ). 

Now I want to get a report about the remaining license count and usage of the existing licenses. 

Please advise.

BR 

Indka

entry.title: Inquiry About Converting Binary Excel Data to PDF in Background Job
entry.content:
Hi.

I currently have an Excel file converted into binary form. I would like to perform the conversion of this binary data into a PDF file using a background job.

I am aware that OLE objects cannot be used in a background job.

Nevertheless, I would like to inquire if there are any possible methods to achieve this.

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,

Sungmin,

entry.title: Using SAP hana-client promises module with TypeScript
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've been using @SAP/hana-client Promises module for many years. A new project is being written on TypeScript, and importing "@sap/hana-client/extension/Promise.js" leads to message "Could not find a declaration file for module '@sap/hana-client/extension/Promise.js'. '(...)/node_modules/@sap/hana-client/extension/Promise.js' implicitly has an 'any' type.
If the '@sap/hana-client' package actually exposes this module, try adding a new declaration (.d.ts) file containing `declare module '@sap/hana-client/extension/Promise.js';". This makes type inferrence impossible on the downstream, so we need to manually type each variable/function declaration to not be of type any.
As @SAP/hana-client has a .d.ts file, I would expect the Promises module to be typed, but then it would probably be imported from the root of the module (as usual with any other lib), instead of being imported directly from the specific .js file.


With that context, I have 2 questions:
1) How/where can I raise an issue to the appropriate SAP team to have this correctly typed (and, even better, importable from the root)?
2) Is there a way we can "type the Promises module ourselves" (via type coercion from the types made available by @SAP/hana-client or something in that sense), so that types can be inferred as expected?

 

Thank you in advance,

Lawisch

entry.title: In S/4HANA what transaction will replace VC/2
entry.content:
We currently use VC/2 for the customer master data transaction, however, we have been told that VC/2 in SAP S/4HANA will no longer be there!

Is this correct?  If so, what transaction is going to replace it?

entry.title: "Camel execution failed‚Äù Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table
entry.content:
Title:

‚ÄúCamel execution failed‚Äù Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table Reference?

Question:

‚ñ† Overview

In our Fiori application, an error occurs when clicking the Register button on a transactional entry screen.
The same code works fine in the test environment, but fails in the production environment.

‚ñ† Environment Setup (Simplified)

  • CDS view is used to read cost department master data (name anonymized)
  • Backend is Node.js, accessing CDS via CAP service
  • The CDS view references a table, passed via variable in the service

‚ñ† Environment Differences

The referenced table has a higher record count in production (e.g. test: 3,000 records, production: 3,500 records).
CDS view definitions and service logic are identical across environments.

‚ñ† Error Message (Excerpt)

 
[SqlError: internal error: Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result] { code: 403, sqlState: 'HY000' }

We noticed the generated SQL contains something like JSON_TABLE('{}'), which may be contributing to the failure when handling empty JSON input under certain conditions.

‚ñ† Code Example (with variable table name)

Here is the original code using a variable for the table name:

 

 
const result = await this.tx.run(
    SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions)
);

This code causes a 403 error only in the production environment.

‚ñ† Temporary Fix (working version)

When we explicitly provided the table name as a string, the issue was resolved:

const table = 'Z_ACTUAL_COST_DEPT_MASTER'; // ‚Üê anonymized actual table name const result = await this.tx.run( SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions) );

‚ñ† Questions

  1. What could be the root cause of the Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result error in this context?
  2. Could the use of JSON_TABLE('{}') in the CDS-generated SQL cause issues in production due to volume or empty JSON input?
  3. Is it possible that using SELECT.from(variable) in CDS behaves differently across environments (e.g. due to view resolution)?
  4. Are there any best practices for safely referencing tables via variables in CDS views, especially for production stability?

‚ñ† Notes

  • Table names and record counts are anonymized.

  • I can provide HANA version and CDS definitions if needed.

entry.title: Node.js @sap/hana-client 2.25.29 getting strange errors on Windows
entry.content:
Since the Node.js @SAP/hana-client version 2.25.29 with @SAP/cds I am getting strange errors on Windows (Linux works fine) like this:

TimeoutError: ResourceRequest timed out
    at ResourceRequest._fireTimeout (node_modules\generic-pool\lib\ResourceRequest.js:62:17)
    at Timeout.bound (node_modules\generic-pool\lib\ResourceRequest.js:8:15)

and when using it together with @SAP/hdi-deploy I get errors about SAP Crypto lib that is missing:

Detection of server version failed; root cause: Connection failed (RTE:[300005] SAP crypto lib is not available: Exception caught in CommonCryptoLib::getInstance (127.0.0.1:53059 -> xxx:443))

When using the previous version 2.25.22 on Windows, it works fine. Can it be that there is something wrong with the native prebuilt binaries for the new version on Windows?

entry.title: Seeking advice for career roadmap
entry.content:
Hello Experts, I'm seeking your guidance on the next steps in my SAP career.

I have over 6 years of hands-on experience in SAP MM, including multiple end-to-end implementation projects. Currently, I'm working in India, but I'm now aiming to gain global exposure, especially in the Gulf region, by working with global consulting firms or end-users. Right now I don't have any offers from the gulf region right now but is looking forward to work in the gulf region.

I already hold a certification in SAP MM (C_TS452) - SAP Certified Associate - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Sourcing and Procurement

To progress further, I want to understand:

Should I expand into SAP EWM, SAP TM, SAP Ariba or any other module?

If yes then which module. What should be the priority list to learn the next modules.

If SAP Ariba is the right direction, which modules should I focus on (e.g., Sourcing, Procurement, Contracts)?

How should I design my career roadmap from here onward to align with global market trends and maximize my opportunities abroad?

I would also like to explore the functionalities of AI and ML in SAP. 

I would truly appreciate advice from senior SAP consultants or those who've made a similar transition. Thanks in advance for your valuable suggestions

entry.title: S4 Brownfield migration does it migrate configuration from ECC to S4 HANA?
entry.content:
I would like to know during brownfield migration from ECC to S4 HANA. Will the configuration of ECC will be moved to new system S4 HANA ? or We need to configure everything as per the business in the S4 HANA according to ECC ?

Also, below points to be considered

1) How about Material master and vendor master existing in the ECC will be linked to S4 HANA ? Do we need to upload materials/vendors via LTMC but how about the same number will be copied. How to link new material with the existing ECC materials?
